p: COX-2 is one of the most important proinflammatory enzyme of action for anti-inflammatory drugs, and celecoxib was a COX-2 selective inhibitor in clinical practice [ 2]. As observed in Table 2, the ethanol crude extract of D. dentiger roots showed significant COX-2 inhibitory effect with an IC 50 value of 77.2 ± 4.2 μg/mL; however, there was an indicated remarkable difference ( p < 0.01) in comparison with that of celecoxib with an IC 50 value of 22.4 ± 1.4ng/mL. To the best of our knowledge, this study was the first time to determine the COX-2 inhibitory activity for D. dentiger [ 12, 13].
